availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Landers Barber (Bath County, Kentucky, farmer and 2nd lieut 24th KY Inf USA, 1st lieut Fleming Co St Guard)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Bath County native. Married to Rhoda Clemmons Barber in Morgan County, Kentucky, on November 30, 1844. Father of John Barber, Mary M. Barber, and William W. Barber. Married to Martha Angeline Henecker Barber in Bath County on November 18, 1852. Father of Martin Barber, Nancy Barber, Daniel Barber, and S. A. Douglas Barber. Farmer in Bath County in 1850. Farmer in Bath County in 1860. Served in the 24th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as second lieutenant from October 1861 to January 1865. Served in Captain Barberâ€™s Company (Fleming County State Guard) as first lieutenant from June 14, 1865, to November 4, 1865.
